body_html:
@devinbostIL It's not supported on Windows. How can I detect that when your MKL PATH is not in environment variable? It is usually listed as MKLProductDir in env vars.

echo %MKLProductDir%
C:\Program Files (x86)\IntelSWTools\compilers_and_libraries\windows
body:
@devinbostIL It's not supported on Windows. How can I detect that when your MKL PATH is not in environment variable? It is usually listed as `MKLProductDir` in env vars.
```cmd
echo %MKLProductDir%
C:\Program Files (x86)\IntelSWTools\compilers_and_libraries\windows
```
